intro: Calochortus weedii var. vestus, commonly known as the Sierra lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes several species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. This particular variety is characterized by its pale pink to white petals and a distinctive yellow center. It typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and grasslands. The plant is often found in California and parts of Nevada, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
